title: Men's Weights
question_text:
The statistics below provide a summary of the distribution of weight, in pounds, from a sample of one hundred adult men:
Minimum: $138\text{ pounds}$
First Quartile: $153\text{ pounds}$
Median: $171\text{ pounds}$
Third Quartile: $192\text{ pounds}$
Maximum: $213\text{ pounds}$
Which of the following statements is always FALSE?

choices.text: $75$ of the men in this sample weigh at least $192\text{ pounds}$.
$25$ of the men in this sample weigh, at most, $153\text{ pounds}$.
$50$ of the men in this sample can weigh, at most, $171\text{ pounds}$.
$50$ of the men in this sample can weigh at least $171\text{ pounds}$.
$25$ of the men in this sample weigh at least $192\text{ pounds}$.
